page.title: 09Blythe Colours-Location
page.content:
Blythe Colours is situated seven miles south of the City of Stoke-on-Trent in the village of Cresswell, a peaceful little place which has a church, a pub, a few small farms and a community of a hundred or so people. Winding it's way through the fields is the river Blythe which is the main reason why Blythe Colours was built there. What is now a vital twenty acres of industrial and commercial activity was once the site of a waterwheel and a small brick shed housing a few grinding pans.
Now their products are transported all over the world by road, rail, air and sea.
